name: Waterfall.Social — Fixed Header & Misc.
description: Fixes the Navigation on Waterfall.Social to the top of the page and condenses the Blogs dropdown, makes the next button on the dashboard 100% width for easier navigation, makes the commission marketplace link stick as you scroll, makes people's blog information stick as you scroll on the default blog theme, unhides the blog information on smaller window sizes for desktop, and has optional fixed editor controls.
additional_info: Last Update: March 8, 2021 Tested in and works with Firefox, Chrome, and Opera. This userstyle fixes the Navigation to the top of the page and condenses the Blogs dropdown so it won't go off the page. It also has minor improvements to the dashboard and default blog themes by giving the blog themes a sticky sidebar and displaying the blog description/title/links when the window size is too small. Additional screenshot of the smaller window menu. To install, you need Stylus. Available for Firefox, Chrome, and Opera. Do not use Stylish (why?). Forewarning: There will be empty space to the right if you only have one blog. Sorry, there's not much I can do about this because of how the blogs dropdown menu is set up. Screenshots are edited with inspect element for my privacy. Changelog: 2021 • March 8 – Sorry it's been a while! Fixed the code to work with the changes made to the site in the last year. 2020 • Jan 21 – Removed fixed to Hellsite Traditional theme as it doesn't exist anymore. Added section with fixed post editor controls (good for long posts, now you don't have to scroll anymore); remove the section or comment out the code in order to go back to the default. • Jan 18 – Fixed regexp to include support.waterfall.social again as it is now just a normal blog and not a Gitea. Also added some other small improvements. 2019 • June 30 – fixed regexp of 1st code block, it wasn't applying to blogs with dashes in the username. • June 12 – added regexp to 1st code block so it'll apply to every subdomain except support.waterfall.social because it was breaking the Gitea. • May 28 – released.
